_header: Be glad O Maid Mother of Christ Jesu
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Gaude virgo mater christi’ —seven stanzas rhyme royal including Envoy

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Be gladde mayde moder of Cryst IhesuWhiche conceyvedist oonly by
                    heringWhane þoohely gooste moost souereyn of vertuEntred þy
                    brest frome heven descending…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…Where with þy sone þou regnest in gladnesseOonly of
                    mercy and stynt oure hevynesse
CamTCC600.Note: Latin lines at head of each stanza.
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
Beholdeþe nowe filowing nexst here þe translacyoune of Gaude
                        virgo mater cristi made by daun Johan þe Munke Lydegate by night as
                    he lay in his bedde at London (p. 53); Gaude virgo mater cristi (p.
                    53)
CamTCC600.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 288-9.

CamTCC601.First Lines:
Be glad o mayde moder of Cryst IhesuWhyche conceuedest oonly by
                    heryngWhen the holy gost most souereyn of vertuEntred thy brest from
                    heuyn discendyng…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…Where with thy son thow regnest in gladnesseOnly of mercy and
                    stynt oure heuynesse

BLHar2251.First Lines:
BE gladde mayde moder of IhesuWhiche conceyvedest only be
                    heryng…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…Where with thy sone thow reignest in gladnesseOnly of mercy
                    and stynt oure hevynesse
BLHar2251.Attributed Title:
Gaude virgo mater cristique per aurem concepisti / gabriele
                        nuncio (f. 234v, margin)
